question.text: In an octahedral structure, the pair of d-orbitals involved in <math><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi> </mi><mi>s</mi><msup><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math> hybridisation is

solution.text: In the formation of <math><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>s</mi><msup><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math> hybrid orbitals, two (<math><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo></math>1)<math><mi>d</mi></math> orbitals of <math><msub><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></math> set i.e., <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi> </mi><msub><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><msub><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msub></math>orbitals, one <math><mi>n</mi><mi>s</mi><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi> </mi><mi>n</mi><mi>p</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>n</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub><mo>,</mo><mi> </mi><mi>n</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi> </mi><mi>n</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> orbitals combine together and form six <math><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>s</mi><msup><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math> hybrid orbitals.
